subject: PE Today: YouTube Open for Debate
body:
CBSNews.com













Prime 
      Time? Not the Point
When we first heard about the 
      YouTube/CNN Presidential Debate, we weren't drinking the Kool-Aid about it 
      being the "groundbreaking" format it was being billed as.  But then 
      we saw the submissions on YouTube -- one from a Viking, 
      some including puppets and action figures -- and realized “Maybe 
      the point isn’t to ‘Be Ready For Prime Time.’" Maybe it’s enough just to 
      be part of the discourse.[+ Read More]



More 
      Internet, Less Sports?TV Networks often don't put news packages 
      about sports and show business on 
      their websites. Why? 
      Potential copyrights issues. Since the rights to show, say, an a 
      baseball game on television don't automatically transfer to the Internet, 
      sports stories are often withheld from network Web sites for legal 
      reasons.  Give it time, though.  
      This purgatory probably won't last too long.[+ Read More]



Wrestling 
      Story's Twists and TurnsAs 
      we noted earlier this week, the grisly 
      story of professional wrestler Chris Benoit killing his wife 
      and child before hanging himself has enough components within it to 
      attract continued attention. (A Google 
      News search shows that over 1,500 stories have been 
      written about it.) And the story gets curiouser by the day, 
      as more disturbing and confusing findings of the investigation 
      emerge.[+ Read More]
